messages: a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (09:22): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, missing a line from your last email?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:24): I can't believe you actually read all the noise I generate :-)
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (09:26): ah well it's a lazy sunday afternoon here :)
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:30): Can the lack of chatter about the Compatibility design principal be taken to mean people are done arguing it?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:31): but probably not
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:35): I have trouble with that, because I really can't understand an abstract desire to break compatibility, independent of a specific list of changes and benefits
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:40): I don't understand David's objection to Don't Reinvent the Wheel
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:40): that's such a common design principle used everywhere, I didn't expect anyone to object to it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:48): I find his latest email unreadable
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:48): I thought his demonstration of abusing a table to draw an image, as evidence that canvas reinvented the wheel, was quite amusing
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:49): well... Hixie did have an animated person done with nothing but HTML elements if I remember right
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:50): I'd like to see him implement this with table abuse: http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/83/play.xhtml
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:50): 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc: that's meant to be a stress test, not an example of a useful technique
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:50): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, I know, I was being sarcastic
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:51): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, Why does the footer drop off the bottom of the game box on that page?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:52): ah, I'll look for a ticket then
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:53): that canvas demo is awesome
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:54): but my mac is too slow to run it well,though my PC was fast enough to run it at the large size
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:54): How old is your mac?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:55): got it beginning of 2006
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:55): It can't possibly be too slow to run that
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:55): it's a Mac mini, before Intel CPUs came out
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:56): it runs it, it's just a bit jumpy
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:57): Aside from the rounding bug where you can mess up the rendering in Safari and the layout issues it runs pretty well for me
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:57): ugh, when it doesn't crash :/
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:58): I got 39 FPS for a while at the small site
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:58): but it sems buggy
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:58): it wouldn't work in Safari for me
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (09:58): dunno if it is a Safari problem or a site problem
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:59): safari complained about me not having an SVG plugin when I tried to load it
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:59): I thought it used canvas, not SVG
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (09:59): I can get 50fps if I jump outside the level with the rounding bug
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:00): Do a little spin as you walk over the step in the middle of the room or turn while you go through the door
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:02): 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc, I tried, but nothing happened
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:02): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: it uses both canvas and SVG
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:02): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: svg just does the random decorative graphics
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:02): I think this page might also be sent with an XML mime type too
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:03): is XML a problem for Safari?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:03): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, try doing a 360 spin in the outside area
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:04): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: no, it's just an odd confluence of technologies
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:05): I discovered yesterday that Safari doesn't default to UTF-8 for XML, which is a bug (though I expect it's a known bug)

8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:06): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, you can cause it by walking from the starting position until you're right on the step out of the blue area and doing a 360 too
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:06): 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc, do you mean in the area with the Firefox and Opera logos on the wall?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:07): in which browser?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:07): Webkit
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:07): heh. 3 crashes on the page so far.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:07): how recent a build?
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:08): most recent from nightly.webkit.org
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:08): It doesn't work in Safari 2.0.4
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:08): lame that they have Firefox and Opera logos but not a Safari or Apple logo in a canvas demo
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:08): it's probably because it only works in FF and O
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:09): goes to download a nightly webkit
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:09): well, that's also kind of lame - probably wouldn't have been too hard to make it work in stock Safari
c52919e46d9f68c9dc04880af9af834d (10:09): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, http://services.ath.cx/logs/1.log http://services.ath.cx/logs/2.log http://services.ath.cx/logs/3.log
c52919e46d9f68c9dc04880af9af834d (10:09): I'm trying to reproduce them
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:10): 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc_: it smells of memory trashing
c52919e46d9f68c9dc04880af9af834d (10:21): Yeah,  that was a 4th one. Different cause again.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:22): it runs faster in WebKit than it does in FF on my mac, but it also crashed
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:24): I would guess something is corrupting the malloc arena, probably by overwriting freed memory
c52919e46d9f68c9dc04880af9af834d (10:26): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220, see what I mean with the rendering getting corrupted if you spin around?
c52919e46d9f68c9dc04880af9af834d (10:28): Resizing the canvas with the tiny->ultra links corrects it most of the time
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:37): yes, 8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc, I got the rendering bug too, and then it crashed soon afterwards
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:41): would love a bug report if y'all have repro steps
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:41): also the layout bug
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:46): alright, I'll reduce it and add one tomorrow.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (10:48): even w/o a reduction a bug report would be great, if you have steps to reproduce it
8b7a61a6e9bd5b8977b7b3f02a425adc (10:48): alright
